intro: Campanula scheuchzeri f. humilis, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The leaves are lanceolate and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
